summary.event: MLOps25 - Workshop on Machine Learning Operations
summary.description: The workshop encourages discussions on bridging the gap between data science experimentation and the reliable operation of ML components in production. It aims to foster the exchange of valuable insights and advancements in the field of MLOps.

submission_types.details: Reports on practical applications, lessons learned, and case studies related to MLOps implementation in real-world scenarios (up to 6 pages + 1 for references).

submission_details.requirements: Submitted work must be original, previously unpublished, and not under consideration or review by any other publication venue.
submission_details.formatting_instructions: Submissions must follow the CEURART style required by CEUR Workshop Proceedings and be double-blind.

publication_details.accepted_papers: Will be published in the CEUR Workshop Proceedings (CEUR-WS.org).
publication_details.extended_version_invitation: Authors of accepted papers will be invited to submit an extended version for consideration in the Special Issue on MLOps Advancements in the journal Future Generation Computer Systems (FGCS).

summary.subject: Call for Papers
topics_of_interest: Practices to ensure ML model reproducibility, traceability, and explainability
Continuous integration/continuous delivery (CI/CD) practices for ML models
Application of MLOps principles to large language models (LLMOps)
Experience reports on real-world MLOps applications
Challenges in applying MLOps to specific domains (e.g., healthcare and finance)
Collaboration and team dynamics in MLOps
Regulatory and policy aspects of MLOps
Security and data privacy in MLOps
